result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Nicholas Mcknight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete Parenting Classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; with random UA's.
No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Nicholas Mcknight

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Nicholas Mcknight appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Antonio Nicholas Mcknight.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs for Jessica Behling in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2, with credit for 5 days served. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1, with credit for 0 days served. Huber privileges to be determined by HOC.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; with random UA's.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 41.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. updated Victim Impact Statement - JB
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Addendum
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed. Neglect Elements of the Offense
Received and Filed. Offer Letter
VIS from JB, filed.
2 child VIS, filed.

Defendant Antonio Nicholas Mcknight in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Joshua Milder for Jessica Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date by Zoom.   Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Antonio Nicholas Mcknight in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Elaine B. Fehrs on behalf of Jessica Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Prelim Waiver, filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Antonio Nicholas Mcknight in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Nicholas Mcknight appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Havas.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rosa, Br. 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
filed.

Case in Court for Status of Counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for Order to Show Cause Hearing, Branch 10.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:

Defendant Antonio Nicholas Mcknight in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Antonio Nicholas Mcknight in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonio Nicholas Mcknight appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
